intro: Xylosma bahamensis, commonly known as Bahamian xylosma, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats and can tolerate salt spray. Xylosma bahamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insects and birds.
